Rimrock Parents and Students:

Rather than requiring students to check in with each teacher, we are making attendance a "one stop" process. This morning, students were emailed an invitation to a Google Classroom called Rimrock Student One Stop. Within this classroom, students will be able to complete a 30-second form to submit attendance. Submitting attendance with this form means they are submitting attendance for ALL of their classes for the day. This form is for attendance only – it will not be used in place of participation in discussion boards/group chats, homework submission, or other assignments given by individual teachers. Students will need to fill out and submit a form each school day (Monday-Thursday) before midnight to be counted as “present”.

For those who have limited or no connectivity, please call the Rimrock office at 208-834-2260.

Idaho High School Suspension of Spring Sports Update

The Idaho High School Activities Association, in response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic is announcing that the mandatory suspension/postponement of activities, which was set to end on April 5th, will continue through April 20th. This new date aligns with the recommendations that came from the Idaho State Board of Education's "soft closure" of schools.

The IHSAA will continue to monitor and align with any future recommendations that come from the Idaho SBOE and Governor Little's office. Our office staff is continuing to work on potential contingency plans for any upcoming spring events that may occur.
